ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: My medication has more positive effects than negative ones.
My medication has more positive effects than negative ones.
Sometimes when I feel better I stop taking the medication.
When I take this medication, I can think in a clearer manner.
This medication does not appear to have any positive effects.
When I take this medication it's like I'm not myself.
I'm ashamed of taking this medication.
Taking this medication prevents relapses.
It's the same whether I take this medication or not.
I find it difficult to take the medication as recommended by the doctor (which pills, at what time?)
It bothers me when my medication is changed.
I plan to stop this medication when feeling better.
Sum of 12 AMBAS items
Sum of following AMBAS items 2, 3, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12
Sum of following AMBAS items 1, 4, 5, 8
